1436772043496824835.text:
That’s what’s made us exceptional throughout our history, and remembering that fact could bring us back together and make sure we continue to lead the world far into the future.

 God bless each of you, and God Bless America!

1436772042389561344.text: And we must never forget that the terrorists who hate us do so, because we are the greatest nation in the world, and we value and respect the freedom and personal liberty of every human being — no matter their race, religion, or nationality.

1436772041462620160.text:
And we’d never forget the thousands of brave men and women who would fight the War on Terror to keep us safe.

Their sacrifice must serve as a reminder of the challenge we continue to face. Just as we did twenty years ago, we must renew our vow to never forget.

1436772040296574983.text: But, most importantly, we all vowed to never forget.  We’d never forget the nearly 3,000 people who died on September 11th.  We’d never forget the heroic sacrifices of the police and firefighters who rushed into harm’s way to save those endangered by the attacks.

1436772039302553605.text:
For a while, we all came together.  Americans of every political leaning cheered our first responders, saluted our brave men and women in the military, flew our flag, and praised President Bush’s decisive response.  

We weren’t Republicans or Democrats, we were Americans.

1436772037817782277.text:
20 years ago today, we suffered the worst foreign attack ever on American soil.

When the 1st plane hit the World Trade Center’s North Tower at 8:46 AM, we were all stunned by what had happened.

In just a little over an hour, our world had changed.

1410723535618592770.text: Consequently, there is no need for the #CCP to communicate its activities to the people, which means it’s accountable to no one but itself.

1410723526231748610.text: We see openness as a virtue, because in democratic societies, we derive our strength directly from the people, and they have a right to know what their representatives are doing. 1410723521949364227.text: My amendment highlights the fact that in China, there is no freedom of the press. 1346926339996020737.text: And it is critical that we, as a nation, find a way to put our differences aside, and focus on those basic beliefs that unite us as Americans.

1346926339002130437.text:
The disturbing violence being reported must stop immediately, and anyone participating in such violent acts must be held accountable.  

Respecting those with whom we disagree is not a matter of politics; it’s a fundamental principle upon which this nation was founded.

1346926338217795584.text: But, we do not, under any circumstances, have the right to violently storm government buildings and threaten the safety of our police officers and our fellow citizens.

1346926337529946118.text: What is occurring right now at the Capitol is completely unacceptable.  In America, we have the right to peacefully assemble and protest.

1334880956340187137.text: Further delay by Congress jeopardizes small businesses and their employees, who cannot wait until the political logjam has cleared. I urge my colleagues, on both sides of the aisle and in both chambers, to come together and pass a common sense relief package.

1334880955463569409.text: Sadly, too many of them are still hurting. PPP loans have supported over 50 million jobs so far—that’s 50 million people in Cincinnati and across America who were able to pay their bills and support their families.

1334880954704420866.text: Yesterday afternoon, I spoke on the House floor in support of my bill to reopen the Paycheck Protection Program. From mom and pop shops to local manufacturers and everything in between, our nation’s small businesses strengthen our communities and our economy.

1334572206437830662.text:
The Paycheck Protection Program has bipartisan backing, and supported millions of #SmallBiz jobs.

There is over $130 billion in remaining PPP funds. 

I have introduced legislation that would reopen the program and ensure aid reaches the small businesses that need it most.

1334547041247178753.text: My bill, HR 8265, would reopen the Paycheck Protection Program and send relief to mom and pop shops.

1334547040580362240.text: I’ve visited over 70 small businesses in my district, many of whom received help through PPP loans. Unfortunately, many small businesses across our nation and our community are still struggling.

1314644106367377408.text: I strongly urge my colleagues to restart this program and implement my suggested changes to ensure that the smallest businesses (those with ten or fewer employees) and minority-owned businesses get the help they need.

1314644104748371972.text:
These workers and their families are in jeopardy through no fault of their own.

Small businesses need our help.
 
Right now, there is over $130 billion dedicated to #PPP.  All it would take is congressional action to get this funding into the hands of small businesses.

1314644103368503297.text: A recent @NFIB survey indicated that 49% of small business owners would need more financial support in the next year & that 22% of borrowers anticipate layoffs in the next 6 months. This is unacceptable.

#PPP was designed to get aid to our nation’s small businesses quickly so that they could keep their workers on payroll during the pandemic.

1285988057762717696.text: This amendment was one of the bipartisan amendments I offered to the now House-passed #NDAA (National Defense Authorization Act).

1285988056449916931.text: I am very pleased that the House added the bipartisan amendment I introduced along with Democratic Congressman @RepBera expressing deep concern over Chinese aggression in the Galwan Valley and #China’s territorial ambitions.

1285988055258718209.text: China’s aggression against #India is an affront to the Indian people and to international law.

1268557279055556608.text: As Congress continues to work in a bipartisan, bicameral manner to support small businesses, I am heartened that we moved quickly to improve this program that has already helped millions of small business owners and their workers.

NEWS: "Ranking Member Chabot Praises Senate Passage of PPP Flexibility Act." 

Read the full statement here: https://t.co/BDXhbFX6nX

1268328315397369856.text:
Small businesses across our nation have saved millions of jobs through the Paycheck Protection Program. 
 
The Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act ensures this program will continue to work for them.

1268328158379597824.text:
The Senate just passed H.R. 7010, the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act. 
 
This bill, which passed the House by 417-1, gives small business owners more choice in how they use their PPP loan funds. It now heads to the President’s desk.

1205600328290308097.text: Earlier this week, I talked to @DanaBashCNN about impeachment then and now. Watch the footage here: https://t.co/vQS12aQHEY https://t.co/0KDv99Pqew

1205260043928690688.text:
Let’s do our jobs as Members of this Committee and thoroughly investigate these allegations to get to the bottom of what happened. 

Justice, history and the American people deserve at least that much.

1205259645973094405.text: . @RepJerryNadler we’ve served on this Committee and even as Chairman and Ranking Member alongside each other. If nothing more, I ask that you, at a minimum, take the time to bring fact witnesses to testify about the alleged quid pro quo.

1205258758605160448.text: What Democrats are doing today is a travesty in which they are setting the standard for future Administrations.

1205258626723696643.text: The majority really should hold themselves in contempt for conducting this one-sided biased impeachment investigation, and then attacking the White House for refusing to participate in such a patently unfair process.

1205258406925361153.text:
You want to talk about an abuse of power?  

What the House Democrats are doing here is a clear case of abusing their office for political gain.

1205257865361014785.text: When Congress disagrees with a particular assertion of executive privilege, the remedy is not impeachment. The remedy is to go to court, and let the third branch of government decide who is correct.

1205257306985897985.text: Executive privilege is a time-honored, constitutionally protected right of each and every Administration. And it has been asserted time and time again, by Administration after Administration.

1205257204716032000.text: Let me make this clear — asserting executive privilege is not, in any way, shape or form, obstruction.

1205256913165979649.text: The second Article of Impeachment is nearly as ridiculous as the first. An obstruction charge requires a concerted effort to interfere with or impede a Congressional investigation.

1205171501412110337.text: But that effort was abandoned because she knows, most Members of Congress know, and now the American people know, 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐬𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐲 𝐰𝐚𝐬𝐧’𝐭 𝐚 𝐜𝐫𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐢𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞.

1205170842231037952.text: I guess we now know why Nancy Pelosi was focus-grouping bribery as a potential charge. Because she was desperately searching for a crime to justify this 𝐬𝐡𝐚𝐦 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.

1205165577771323394.text: .@HouseDemocrats If that’s the best you’ve got, you wasted a whole lot of time and taxpayer dollars, all because the leftist, Democrat base hates this President.

1205165181191544832.text: Let me put it another way — the entire argument for impeachment is based on a charge that is not a crime (much less a high crime) and that has NEVER been approved by the House of Representatives in a Presidential Impeachment.

1205164886650699776.text: In the Nixon and Clinton impeachments, abuse of power was a tacked-on charge, far less important in those cases than the actual high crimes charged against both men. Here, it’s the main thrust of the House Democrats’ entire case.

1205164676620918786.text: There is another significant difference between the abuse of power charges against Nixon and Clinton, and those presented here.

1205164418239205376.text: Based on the actual facts of this case (as opposed to the hearsay and innuendo compiled by the Intelligence Committee), it doesn’t appear that an abuse of power even took place, and there certainly isn’t enough evidence to support an article of impeachment.

1205164097098174464.text: Fourth, despite all the efforts to establish evidence of a quid pro quo by House Democrats, Ukraine did nothing to assure the release of the aid. There was no public announcement of an investigation. In fact, it doesn’t appear that the investigation was even opened.

1205162533042167810.text: Third, Ukraine actually received the aid after the President was satisfied that Ukraine had taken meaningful steps to address corruption. Which, again, is an obligation required by law.

1205162195216154624.text: President Trump was well aware of that fact and quite skeptical of giving Ukraine foreign aid long before the now-infamous July 25 phone call.

1205161103359127556.text: Second, it’s a widely known fact that Ukraine is one of the most corrupt countries on the planet. It’s why Congress required the Administration to certify that the Ukrainian government had taken steps to clean up corruption before military aid could be provided to the country.

1205160605730181121.text: First, there was no quid pro quo.

1205158254877253632.text: In this case, the evidence provided is even less convincing. In fact, I’d argue it is 𝐰𝐨𝐞𝐟𝐮𝐥𝐥𝐲 𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐪𝐮𝐚𝐭𝐞.

1205157902186635265.text: In the interests of fairness, I believed that Bill Clinton had abused the power of his office, but we failed to convince our colleagues. The facts didn’t satisfy the higher burden of proof, and that particular charge was rejected by the full House.

1205157644824129537.text: What they don’t mention is that the House of Representatives has NEVER adopted abuse of power as a charge in a Presidential Impeachment.

1205157441358487555.text: In their newly authored memo on constitutional grounds for impeachment, the majority on this Committee goes to great lengths to explain why abuse of power is an impeachable offense, specifically mentioning it was one of the charges against both Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton.

1205156849101803521.text: Impeachment is reserved for instances of “Treason, Bribery and other high Crimes and Misdemeanors.” It’s not “Treason, Bribery, other high Crimes and Misdemeanors” OR whatever else Nancy Pelosi and Adam Schiff deem impeachable.

1205156581903605761.text: The Constitution is pretty clear on what constitutes an impeachable offense.

1205151486918963202.text: Here are my remarks from last night's @JudiciaryGOP  markup: https://t.co/yRqwJMRzSS https://t.co/DXNs71PnpF

1204943886822629377.text:
This is a sad day in American history, Mr. Chairman. 

The folks in the liberal media might be cheering you on, but I highly doubt that either history, or the American people, will judge you so leniently.

1204943588292993025.text: To satisfy their base’s extreme hatred of President Trump, House Democrats have taken a blowtorch to House rules, the rule of law, and most frighteningly, to the Bill of Rights.

1204943442641592321.text: If George Orwell had written the script, no one would’ve believed it.  People would say that it’s ridiculously implausible. And yet here we are.

1204943288513519616.text:
Tomorrow, this committee will hold a vote to impeach a president, without having heard from a single fact witness, and without allowing the minority party the ability to call any witnesses or present any defense. 

What a travesty of justice!

1204942827232333824.text: The Chairman of this committee, and the majority have seen fit to abuse this committee’s rules, and ignore the rights of the minority with impunity.

1204942671598501889.text: At the same time, Republicans on this committee were denied their absolute right to have a minority hearing day, which is guaranteed by this committee’s own rules.

1204942404815609856.text: On Monday, during our second hearing, w/o any fact witnesses, we had the bizarre situation in which rather than Members questioning witnesses, we had staff questioning staff, & even had a staff witness get up from the witness stand & begin questioning another staff witness.

1204942227413164033.text: On Wednesday, this Committee, the committee actually charged with handling impeachment, held the first of two hearings, in which we heard from EXACTLY ZERO fact witnesses.

1204942063529279488.text: After the farce in the Intelligence Committee, we had dumped in our laps a report, recommending impeachment, with no time to adequately consider or review the materials.

1204941701325959169.text: We are witnessing an inexplicable rush to impeach a President who is disliked, no loathed, by most of my Democratic colleagues, and by their supporters, and as a result of that loathing, they have seen fit to abandon all basic tenets of fairness, due process, and justice.

1204941229580001286.text: We are witnessing, I believe, the most tragic mockery of justice, in the history of this nation.

1204941037141135360.text: I have to say that the last few weeks have been just about the most incredible, and by that I mean most unbelievable, few weeks in my 23 years of service in this Congress.

1202967577389088770.text: ICYMI, here are my remarks from the sham impeachment hearing: https://t.co/ZGj15o875E

1202318478578999297.text: You may be able to twist enough arms in the House to impeach the President, but the effort’s going to die in the Senate. The President’s going to serve out his term in office, and in all likelihood, be elected to a second term, with the help of this impeachment charade.

1202316600579411968.text: I get it, Democrats on this committee don’t like this President. They don’t like his policies. They don’t like him as a person. They hate his tweets. They don’t like the fact that the Mueller investigation was a 𝐟𝐥𝐨𝐩. So now they’re going to impeach him.

1202316260417163265.text: Chairman @RepJerryNadler is moving forward with a totally party-line impeachment, which he has repeatedly warned against in the past. There is NOT a broad consensus of the American people.

1202316117986951168.text: Why is Chairman @RepJerryNadler not letting us call Adam Schiff or Hunter Biden as witnesses?

1202315816911421449.text: Today, we are undertaking a largely 𝘢𝘤𝘢𝘥𝘦𝘮𝘪𝘤 𝘦𝘹𝘦𝘳𝘤𝘪𝘴𝘦, instead of hearing from fact witnesses, like Adam Schiff or Hunter Biden.

1202315689048072192.text: The hardcore, Trump-hating, base wants to vote to impeach President Trump. They’ve wanted it since President Trump won the election three years ago.

1202315638884179969.text: No matter what questions we ask these four witnesses, and no matter what answers they give, most, if not all, of the Democrats on this committee, are going to vote to impeach President Trump.

1176902982719422464.text:
The First Responders Passport Act:

✅ Strengthens existing passport fee exemptions for state/locally employed first responders contracted with the US Gov to deploy abroad

✅ Extends exemption to volunteer first responders, who play a critical role on disaster response teams

1176902356589568000.text: The First Responders Passport Act, gives the Secretary of State discretion to waive passport fees for first responders contracted to help the US Government respond to natural disasters abroad, like Hurricane Dorian.
